page.title: 06LEISURE TIME IN STOTTESDON
page.content: In the list of people's leisure {activities}T.V. viewing appeared most often, followed in order by reading, gardening <1/2 grow their own veg.>, visiting the Pub, home maintainance, sewing & knitting &c., & walking. Of the active sports swimming was the most popular, though it is 10mls to the pool. The numerous leisure{groups}to which people belong reflect the wide spread of their interests eg. WI, Brass Band, Gliding club, Br Legion, Darts club, Vintage Vehicle clubs, Aerobic class. 44% of families go on{holiday}less than once a year, if ever. Of those who go, more than half take a week or less, & more have U.K. than foreign holidays. Families holidaying together go for self-catering. People not accompanied by children like organised tours with hotel accommodation.
